item_title: Items W21a-b, below will share a combined staff report and combined hearing
subitem_title: Application No. 5-18-0267 (City of Santa Monica Pedestrian & Trail Improvements)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Santa Monica to widen approx. 1 mile of Ocean Front Walk (OFW) pedestrian path and 2 miles of Marvin Braude Bike Trail (Beach Trail) at Santa Monica State Beach, from 14-ft. to 30-ft., including 12-ft. wide pedestrian path and 14-ft. wide bicycle path separated with concrete buffer. Other trail improvements include: development of paved (Pier Plaza) adjacent to Santa Monica Pier; new seat walls, lighting, and paving along Ocean Front Walk portion of trail; and replacement of existing wall under Santa Monica Pier Bridge with concrete wall of like dimensions, at Santa Monica State Beach, Santa Monica, Los Angeles County. (AS-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 9-19-0025 (Southern California Edison, San Clemente)
subitem_blurb: Application by Southern California Edison (SCE) to construct 210 acre low-relief kelp reef offshore of City of San Clemente, in depths ranging from 38 to 49 feet. The proposed reef is an expansion of the existing 174 acre Wheeler North Reef that was required as mitigation for impacts associated with operation of San Onofre Nuclear Generating Station (SONGS) in San Clemente, Orange County. (KH-SF)

(DV-V)

item_title: Presentation “Making Visible Stories of African Americans and the California Dream”
item_blurb: Historian Dr. Alison Rose Jefferson will give an educational slide presentation on the discrimination faced by African Americans at Southern California beaches. The presentation will include photographs and other materials to illustrate the African American beach culture experience during the Jim Crow era.  Exhibit materials will be on display throughout the Commission meeting.
Public hearing and possible Commission action on the Commission’s Environmental Justice Policy. (JA/NS-SF)

(MV-LB)
